title: Improve tournament loading times
message:
Improve tournament loading times

Given that there's a valid tournament to load, then show the tournament and players as soon as that data is fetched from Challonge, don't wait for smash rankings.

Given that the players have been fetched from Challonge, then smash rankings for each player should be fetched in the background with a thread pool.

When a smash ranking is fetched, then UI should update immediately.

Did a major refactor where the model is now a infinite observable stream and immutable, which makes it a lot easier to reason about it's state.

title: Add Jacoco code coverage
message:
Add Jacoco code coverage
Create jacocoTestReport task that combines code coverage result from
unit tests and Espresso tests.

To build APK, PMD, FindBugs, Checkstyle, Unit Test, Espresso tests and Jacoco all at once:
./gradlew clean build createDebugCoverageReport jacocoTestReport

The code coverage result is found under "build/reports/jacoco/jacocoTestReport".

Dart/Hanson
Implemented the Dart/Hanson extras "injection" library which made the Navigator obsolete.
The Navigator was potentially a large, complex and centralized class and infringed the
Meyer's open/closed principle.

message:
Clear file cache before running Espresso tests
Espresso tests would sometimes fail if we had cached objects and it's value differed
from the expected. To make tests less flaky, file cache is automatically cleared before
each Espresso test.

title: Io Executor Scheduler
message:
Io Executor Scheduler
Change executor scheduler from "newThread" to "io". Uses a
unbounded thread pool which should be more suited for network
requests. Might want to create a custom scheduler to get a bounded
thread pool incase we have many simultaneous requests to prevent
exhausting resources.

title: Idling Resource improved
message:
Idling Resource improved
No longer wraps the tournament manager but instead holds a reference to it.
This way the test tournament module isn't needed anymore. We get
notified about state cleverly enough through the model stream observable.
Works just as fast and stable as before with heavily reduced boilerplate.
Had to downgrade retrolambda from beta to stable since it wouldn't build in
android tests.

title: Idling Resource
message:
Idling Resource
The AsyncTask Scheduler caused flaky Espresso tests, likely because
the tournament manager executes several use cases after another and
espresso have time to get in between them and try to touch the views when
they aren't there yet.

The solution now is to wrap the tournament manager in a idling resource
so we can control the flow of the espresso tests. As long as the manager is
in "SEARCHING" state Espresso will wait, which seems very stable and fast.
The downside is that a new test module was needed to inject the wrapper,
which is a bit of boilerplate. On the plus side the test code is transparent to
the production code.

title: More Espresso tests and updated dependencies
message: More Espresso tests and updated dependencies

title: Mockwebserver rule
message:
Mockwebserver rule
Mock server setup is handled by a TestRule, which makes test code much cleaner
and reusable. @NeedsMockWebServer annotation enqueues responses before activity
is started as specified by its setupMethod. The rule will also change the baseUrl of
the client api's to point the url of the mock server.

Since mockwebserver runs asynchronously Scheduler.immediate() will throw network
on main thread exception. The solution was AsyncTask.THREAD_POOL_EXECUTOR
since espresso will wait for AsyncTask's to complete before proceeding. More advanced
use cases might require Idling Resources, but for now this is sufficient.

title: Mockwebserver for espresso tests
message:
Mockwebserver for espresso tests
Mocking the web server responses lets us test all the way down to serialization.
The problem with this solution right now is that the mockwebserver runs
async, which causes network on main thread exception if we run in UI-thread.
Setting the execution thread to "io()" solves this but then we have to implement
espresso idling resource. Found a okhttp-idling-resource library by Jake Wharton
but it's still early in development and only available as a SNAPSHOT depending
 on a unreleased version of OkHttp. Will keep an eye on this.

title: Fix tournament not working with Challonge preregistration
message:
Fix tournament not working with Challonge preregistration
When preregistered through Challonge, the app would say you're not registered
for this tournament even though you were. The cause was that the participant
name would be empty if it was the same as Challonge username. The solution
was to instead use the display name since it's never empty.
